attributes.action: let Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol
attributes.background:
Amend the misuse of Drugs act  and Psychoactive Substance Bill To allow Pubs And clubs to sell THC Infused Drinks as a safer alternative to Alcohol.
I Believe this will reduce the level of drink related crime and is well known to be much less physically harmful than alcohol

attributes.action: Introduce a plan of anti-ransomware measures
attributes.background: Ransomware computer viruses target more and more ordinary UK citizens and organizations. Viruses like described here: http://myspybot.com/odin-virus/ cause huge damages. Millions flow away into cyber criminals' pockets. We want to know what is being done to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
Plenty of things an be done:

 - Government can strengthen cryptocurrencies related laws. For example, make Bitcoin exchange companies keep records of their users.   

- Government can cooperate with security professionals to develop decryption tools.

- Government can introduce stronger online data protection policies. Organizations should create backups of their data.

- Government can raise awareness that we should stop paying to hackers. Make paying immoral and maybe illegal.

attributes.action: Stop tax exiles from claiming government subsidies of any sort
attributes.background:
If anyone chooses to be a tax exile and not pay their fair share of tax to the British people then they should be excluded from the tax system completely, this  should include receiving any form of taxpayers money
If they wish to opt out of the system they should opt out completely

attributes.action: 80 characters is not enough to express a political request. Extend limit to >999
attributes.background: I want to write a petition to the government not a twitter comment and I want people to understand from the outset what I want and why. Limiting the number of charterers I can write is extremely restrictive to allowing voters to express themselves.

attributes.action: Ban Votes for anyone over the age of 70
attributes.background: In the referendum most young people- 17 or below did not have the chance to decide their future, where old pensioners were allowed to vote and decide our future for us! We want more control for young people!
attributes.additional_details: Such as in the referendum, despite a petetion and growing debate for votes for 16 year olds, the number of old people is on the increase, due to the baby boomers getting older! Therefore to restrict the age this way it would help keep down the number of old people voting and put more decision in the younger generations.

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: The general election must be made a public holiday.
attributes.background: This will help increase voter turnout.

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to use entrapment to produce 'sensational' stories
attributes.background:
It is too easy for journalists to entrap an unsuspecting victim into revealing information that they wouldn't volunteer if they knew that they were talking to the press.
This can cause people to lose their jobs or cause humiliation
It is deceitful and fraudulent. But is it in the public interest.
attributes.additional_details:
Sex Scandals, Politicians, Celebrities. The only reason they do it is to increase their market share, yet claim it is in the public interest.
This could ruin an aspiring politician, business person or celebrity for a good scoop.
Most recent case is Sam Alerdice, the former England Manager, who revealed some embarrassing 'trade secrets' to what he thought were businessmen, but were gutter press.

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: Restrict the ability to freely purchase sperm on Internet websites and now apps
attributes.background: It is grossly unacceptable to completely disregard a mans ability and purpose to father children. Women have the ability to freely browse Internet websites and now mobile apps for sprem based on specific requirements of donors eg height, IQ, race "without a medical reason". It's morally wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
I don't want to promote the websites and/or apps but it's free to download and sperm can be bought for the price of £950 at the click of a button without a medical reason.
If this catches on it could be a huge problem that would leave men unable to naturally father children and I find this seriously disturbing.

attributes.action: Request the Football Association to boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background: Russia's state-sponsored drugs abuse in sport, human rights contraventions, cyber hacking, actions in Ukraine and Syria, and total disdain for world opinion, demonstrates that it should not be rewarded by being allowed to host a World event.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130

attributes.action:
Remove the UK from membership of the UN.
This organisation has become a pariah.
attributes.background: The UN has presided over countless deaths of civilians over the years and has lost its way in the new world of aggression where all countries seek are weapons and power. We need a court like system, signed up to by all with real penalties for transgressors.
attributes.additional_details:
I offer history as a witness and evidence. Name one conflict resolved by the UN?
It has become clear since the 1960's that the UN is an organisation mired in politics and self interest. The rules created for countries to debate are being abused in a wholesale and cynical fashion. Their must be a better way by way of a court which member states adhere to or else they are dismissed from the organisation. The bailiffs of the court will be member countries having no interest in the actions at hand and able to use full force to achieve the edicts of the  court. No more should soldiers stand by and witness rape, murder and torture. No more should cynical members be able to abuse the courts decisions with a veto.

attributes.action: Stop payroll co.'s charging admin fees to agency workers for processing earnings
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies use payroll companies to process agency worker earnings. The worker is commonly charged up to £20 per week simply to receive their pay! This equates to around £1,000 per year often taken from low paid workers.

attributes.action: Create a virtual parliamentary constituency for serving armed forces personnel.
attributes.background: The choice of voting for the constituency a Serving Member (and his/her family) find themselves in (when based in the UK) or voting for a constituency they had lived in previously is often unsatisfactory.  In my experience serving members don't vote at all and few use their MP.
attributes.additional_details: The creation of a virtual constituency will give serving members of the Armed Forces and their families the opportunity to vote for a person who will directly represent them in Parliament, regardless of where they are based. Critically it will allow the incumbent MP, regardless of party, to immerse him/herself in the specific needs of serving personnel and their families. This role is to be independent of the MoD and the Minister of State for the Armed Forces which reflect Government needs.

attributes.action: Honour  Paralympians & Olympians by declaring an extra bank holiday in 2016
attributes.background: As a comparatively small island together we have come second in the Medals table for the 2016 Olympics, and are currently second in the Paralympics medal table. This is a quite remarkable achievement.
attributes.additional_details: Lets make it happen, and demonstrate that we are proud of their achievements and know how to celebrate.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Completely change the old system of education we have today.
attributes.background: Uk needs a modern integral education based on the talents and abilities of students; so that when they finish secondary they know three languages and have a defined job. Children 0-6 years will learn playing, 7-11 years will learn practicing at school, 12-16 years will learn practicing in companies.
attributes.additional_details: The education be taught with computers and practices they will be guided by specialized teachers in each area; so that at years a child will be in the ability to program a computer and at 12 years he will have a profession. With the new system of education in the 21st century; let's educate for entrepreneurs to be those that produce jobs and not like the old traditional education, which teaches to create simple employees. We are going to take advantage of the new technologies and scientific advances to integrally educated and with high quality our children, who are the future of the Nation.

attributes.action: Change length of time that offences stay on a persons criminal record to 10 yrs
attributes.background: If an offence stays on your record for life you're punished for life. The law should be changed so that if no further crimes are committed after 10 years the offence should be removed from there basic record. Enhanced checks for work places with children/vulnerable adults should stay permanently.
attributes.additional_details: Any offence with a 30 month+ sentence stays on record for life regardless of the type of crime/number of offences committed. Yes people need to be punished for breaking the law but if there sentence is served and they commit no further crimes they should be able to move on and build a life. People cannot get jobs because of their record and end up re-offending, homeless and with mental health issues. Changing the law will reduce crime rates, improve peoples well-being.

attributes.action: Remove the pension lifetime allowance.We want to be self-reliant in retirement.
attributes.background: The current  lifetime allowance means we will not have enough pension income  in retirement. We want to have enough income so we are not reliant on the state and with a decent pension income, we will fuel the economy. This makes even more sense as the population is ageing. Please think again!
attributes.additional_details: As an example, a final salary pension of £18k p.a. eats up 58% of the lifetime allowance before any further pension savings are made. It does not leave much headroom and will not equate to extravagant riches in old age. Please reconsider the lifetime allowance limit.

attributes.action: Ban the Prime Minister and Cabinet from receiving cash in exchange for meetings
attributes.background: Prime Minister Theresa May is selling lunch meetings with herself at her 2016 party conference for £3,150.
attributes.additional_details:
See reports in the Guardian https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/02/theresa-may-3150-lunch-democracy-for-sale-lobbyists?CMP=fb_gu 

and the
Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/01/business-leaders-charged-3000-a-head-to-have-lunch-with-theresa/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Insist the US provides explanation as to why J. Miah was denied entry to the US.
attributes.background: Juhel Miah was denied entry to the US based on nothing tangible. Seemingly the reason doesn't even link to the disproportionate and now illegal travel ban enforced by Donald Trump's administration.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Foreign Office has even stated that no one with a British passport will be denied entry to the US - so why?

attributes.action: Require autonomous vehicles to display a visible warning beacon when in motion.
attributes.background: As a software engineer with many years' experience, I  think that mixing AVs with conventional traffic on public roads is  highly risky, with potentially serious/fatal consequences for road users. It will require many years of development to perfect the tech in all weathers/conditions.
attributes.additional_details: There have already been several incidents reported in the USA.

attributes.action: Create Protocol for Government Intervention in Strikes (e.g. Southern stalemate)
attributes.background: We would like to petition the government to seriously contemplate introducing a system in which labour disputes involving services essential to our economy, such as the Southern rail strike, can be handled in the case of long-running disruption and lack of agreement between the principle parties.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the that government consider methods implemented by other nations, for example Canada, where the options include binding arbitration [For more information: http://www.cbc.ca/1.1000525]

Though we cannot quantify what the Southern rail strike has cost the economy, it certainly has had an effect; ramifications on citizens' lives must also be appreciated. In situations such as these, it would be beneficial to have a governmental framework in place. 

With thanks for your consideration.

attributes.action: Stop paying subsidies for renewables because they are adding CO2 not reducing it
attributes.background: The thermal efficiency of Closed Cycle Gas Turbines (CCGTs) when ramping up and down in response to wind generation drops for up to 4 hours and each end of the ramping process. This increases the amount of gas that is burned so that 35kg of CO2 is emitted for every MWh generated by wind generation.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/9559656/Germanys-wind-power-chaos-should-be-a-warning-to-the-UK.html

http://www.heraldscotland.com/opinion/letters/15087524.Renewables_has_so_far_been_failed_experiment/

attributes.action: Repeal and replace the NFAOP act 1861 with something new and up to date
attributes.background: The best ways in which parliament could update this act is by putting the offences of ABH and GBH in the same act as battery and assault so the law is more concise. In addition to this they could actually define what GBH and ABH is rather than leaving it to the courts to define.
attributes.additional_details: This act is used daily. It is over 150 years old, and lacks key definitions. It is an extremely important act of Parliament, even being considered the workhorse of the legal system by some. The courts themselves have had to define key terms including what constitutes as ABH (Chan Fook) and what constitutes as Wounding (Eisenhower). It shouldn't be left to the courts to decide what Parliament meant when writing the acts as Parliament should have done a good enough job in defining these terms.

attributes.action: Increase national insurance contributions by £5 a person a month to save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is in crisis. I'm sure most if not everyone would be happy to pay an extra £5 a month in national insurance contributions to help save our special health care system. 
We cannot lose the NHS, or is that what the conservative government want...

attributes.action: Reduce taxes for U30s that earn below £25,000
attributes.background: It is a constant struggle for those who are starting a career , whilst living somewhere where there are a number of career opportunities.  A tax break would help with rents and affordability of life, and reduce debt for those starting off their own life.

attributes.action: capita to lose the contract for moving nhs records.
attributes.background: I suffer from MS and cannot be referred to a new MS nurse because my record have not reached my new GP after 3 months and some have to wait 6 months+, its not safe.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds apply for their provisional without having to wait 9 months.
attributes.background: Some teenagers are in stress of having to wait 9 months for a provisional, and I believe that if we lower the age of applying for a provisional, it would really help. Also, if teenagers start driving with experienced drivers at a younger age it would help them drive better in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Also, in emergency cases, if the experienced person is injured or is in need of help the teenager could help by driving to the local hospital or home etc.

attributes.action: Incentivise the switch from diesel to electric & low emission petrol vehicles.
attributes.background: Diesel vehicles cause thousands of deaths per year and unnecessarily put huge pressure on the health service. An incentivised scrap & switch scheme for diesel vehicles is the only way the government can ensure pollution is reduced and diesel cars are taken off the road.
attributes.additional_details:
"UK air pollution 'linked to 40,000 early deaths a year'" - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35629034

"Diesel cars should be phased out to stop pollution deaths, says Chief Medical Officer " - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/30/diesel-cars-should-phased-stop-pollution-deaths-says-chief-medical/

"Five facts about diesel the car industry would rather not tell you" - https://www.transportenvironment.org/sites/te/files/publications/2015_09_Five_facts_about_diesel_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: The establishment of UK legislation protecting Net Neutrality
attributes.background: The free and open internet as it is today has fostered innovation, provided access to information, and facilitated many cultural, economic and political opportunities across this world. It is a driver and tool of innovation, globally and here in the UK. And should be protected so it is not lost.
attributes.additional_details: With the Great Repeal Bill coming forward, we have concerns over the potential loss of protection to Net Neutrality. While the Broadcasters Stakeholders Group has a Code of Practise, this is a voluntary measure and if the UK was to open up contracts to global companies for future trade deals, this measure may not be enough to safeguard Net Neutrality here in Britain. We want the government to take early action and also establish the UK as a global leader in safeguarding a free and open internet.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Irish unity
attributes.background: with the majority of Northern Ireland voting to remain in the EU and with a new generation now living in peace, it is the right time for the people of Northern Ireland to decide on their long term future democratically and peacefully
attributes.additional_details: It's been 44 years since the last referendum on Irish unity in 1973 and now with a new generation both North and south, with a growing economy in the Republic of Ireland and particularly after the recent Eu referendum with a majority voting in Northern Ireland voting to remain, the time is right to hold a new referendum for the people of Northern Ireland to determine their future peacefully and democratically for the good of all citizens.

attributes.action: Stop sanctions for Jobseekers of 4 weeks or more
attributes.background: People would have no money for food, heating, electricity, clothes and toiletries and risk becoming homeless.  The claimant commitments are too unrealistic and not everyone has access to computers for Universal jobmatch every day or skills needed.
attributes.additional_details:
JSA is only £72 per week and some people must pay Council tax and housing out of this.
Job centre work coaches are getting stressed about issue as they are on the front line and must implement this cruel sanctioning.  Some leave due to a conscience.

attributes.action: Give top Government priority to tackle all sexual abuse, especially child abuse
attributes.background:
Child abuse is a national scandal. 

Rape and sexual abuse of any kind should never be tolerated. Far too little is being done

The Government should give the highest priority to this scandal

This petition pleads for all political parties to unite to stamp down on sexual abuse of all forms
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 20 children are abused (NSPCC)

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

Nearly half a million adults are sexually assaulted each year

In 2015/16 police recorded 23,851 adults were raped; 5878 children. 

Only 2,689 convictions (7.5%). In 2011/12 15% were convicted. These figures are a scandal.

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence

Only around 15% of those who experience sexual violence choose to report to the police

attributes.action: Parental responsibility should be transferred to the parent who has residency.
attributes.background: Currently the law indicates that Parental Responsibility is those who have legal rights and responsibilities for the child's upbringing, who can make decisions regarding schooling, name changes etc. I want the government to debate if the law should be amended in the cases where a parent wants no
attributes.additional_details: further contact with a child and cases of harm to the child, for the responsibility and decision making to be transferred over to the remaining parent. My sons father is unable to see his son due to the CAFCASS report and he also informed court he wants no further contact. I have changed my sons surname by Deedpoll but passport etc needs authorisation and permission from the father, even in these circumstances when all evidence shown. These rights should be abolished.

attributes.action: Save our NHS/Social care
attributes.background: The goverment has proved incapable of saving the NHS/social care and making the necessary decisons necessary to do this.  We the public demand taxation is increased and all money raised goes to NHS/Social services only & foreign aid used when people from overseas using our NHS are unable to pay
attributes.additional_details: In order to save NHS/Social care services taxation must be increased with certain conditions applied which must include firstly any extra money raised must ONLY go to the NHS/Social care services, secondly NHS and Social care services must be more integrated, thirdly less financial support for conditions with relate to lifestyle choices such as obesity, alcoholism and drug abuse and finally payment for those using our NHS/Social care from abroad unable to pay taken from foreign aid

attributes.action: Free childcare hour from their 3rd birthday
attributes.background:
In Scotland children from their 3rd birthday get their free hours of child care but in England we have to wait until the next term.
I would like every child on their 3rd birthday to get their free hours

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: NHS to revert back to using bank nurses and stop using agency nurses.
attributes.background: I am informed by my local MP Rt Hon David Evennett MP that the NHS saved £600 million in the first year of reducing using agency staff.  Obviously to stop this use would be a worthwhile saving particular as the NHS needs the money urgently now.

attributes.action: I'd like to see the NHS running the National Lottery and keeping all profits.
attributes.background:
We are losing the NHS, it needs emergency care immediately.
Lets start with the obvious and put in a line. We do have one available.
That infusion can come from the National Lottery.

attributes.action: Amend the Aggravated Murder of and  Violence against Women Bill to include men
attributes.background: The Bill had its first reading in Parliament on the 31st January 2017. The obvious thing that was picked up by one member of parliament, that being Philip Davies, was that he recognised that the bill was sexist. How it got approved is beyond comprehension.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cats except from registered breeders.
attributes.background: The stray cat population is out of control. Sale of cats should be restricted to registered breeders who neuter and meet animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: UK should allocate more of its aid and development money to endangered species
attributes.background:
A proviso should be added to the aid and development money that we provide to Africa, that some of the money must to go towards endangered species.
Hopefully if the UK put aside more funds for endangered species, the African governments will also make a change.

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of Alcohol on UK TV.
attributes.background:
The UK Government are living in the dark ages, they have put a clear ban on all Tobacco products, banning smoking in public places and at work, Banning all TV adverts for Tobacco products.

Alcohol should be banned, there are more kids Drinking in 2017 than there are Smoking.

Alcohol is worse.
attributes.additional_details:
Go to you local street corner and look at the kids and what they are doing PM's.

Most of them are getting pissed only 2 out of 5 will be smoking.

Get a grip on real life and wake up.

attributes.action: Build A Road Link From Great Britain To Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
I'd like to see a road link be built with either a bridge or tunnel from the mainland (Great Britain), to Northern Ireland.
Not only would this connect the whole of the UK, but I belive would benefit trade between the home nations.
All of a sudden, Northern Ireland would be much more accessible.

attributes.action: Introduce free drug purity test kits into Pharmacies across Britain.
attributes.background: Too many young individuals are taking drugs that in most cases are not what they are said to be, leading to cases of serious harm and often death. Drug consumption is not something that can be stopped, but can be made safer with the introduction of these purity testing kits that could save lifes.
